item.title: 英国保守党誓言废除气候变化法案
item.description: 英国反对党保守党计划在重新执政后废除《气候变化法》，这是英国长期以来在气候行动上达成的政治共识已经破灭的最新迹象。【原文：The UK’s opposition Conservative Party plans to scrap the Climate Change Act if it returns to power, the latest indication that the longstanding political consensus on climate action in Britain has shattered.】

item.title: 教皇利奥十四世呼吁 "生态转型 "以应对气候变化
item.description:
教皇在他的首次重要气候演讲中重申了梵蒂冈对抗全球变暖的承诺，尽管世界部分地区在减排方面出现了倒退。【原文：

The Pope reaffirmed the Vatican’s commitment to fighting global warming in his first major climate speech, even as parts of the world backslide on cutting emissions.

】

item.title: 美国环保局欲撤销氢氟碳化合物超级污染物规定
item.description:
该机构建议推迟淘汰空调和冰箱中使用的化学物质，这些物质会释放出高浓度的温室气体。【原文：

The agency is proposing delaying the phaseout of chemicals used in ACs and refrigerators that can release highly potent greenhouse gases.

】

item.title: 洪水保险公司 Neptune 在美国首次公开募股 3.68 亿美元后股价上涨 16
item.description: 海王保险控股公司（Neptune Insurance Holdings Inc.【原文：Neptune Insurance Holdings Inc. shares jumped as much as 16% after the flood insurance company’s shareholders raised $368.4 million in a US initial public offering.】

item.title: 特朗普计划审查 Equinor 在纽约附近的 Empire Wind 2 项目
item.description: 特朗普政府告诉一家联邦法院，它打算重新考虑美国政府的一项重要审批，该审批批准了 Equinor ASA 在纽约和新泽西附近计划建设的海上风电项目的第二阶段。【原文：The Trump administration told a federal court it intends to reconsider a key US government approval that authorized the construction of Equinor ASA’s planned second phase of an offshore wind project near New York and New Jersey.】

item.title: 随着购物者转向更高级的特产鸡蛋，Cal-Maine 品牌鸡蛋价格暴跌
item.description: 美国最大的鸡蛋生产商 Cal-Maine Foods Inc. 注意到了市场上的一个主要趋势：消费者正在转向他们认为更可持续的高端品种。【原文：Cal-Maine Foods Inc., the top US egg producer, is noticing a major trend in the market: consumers are shifting to fancier varieties that they consider to be more sustainable.】

item.title: 特朗普、数据中心和昂贵的天然气如何推动美国煤炭复兴
item.description: 美国煤炭行业今年形势大好。对这种最脏的化石燃料的需求正在增加，公用事业公司正在加大发电厂的运行力度，矿工们也在提高产量。【原文：The US coal industry is having a good year. Demand for the dirtiest fossil fuel is increasing, utilities are running their plants harder, and miners are boosting production.】

item.title: 特朗普将在停摆期间继续发放石油许可证，冻结可再生能源
item.description: 特朗普政府计划在政府关门期间允许石油钻探许可证和其他 "优先常规能源项目 "的工作继续进行，而一些可再生能源项目的工作将停止。【原文：The Trump administration plans to allow permits for oil drilling and other work on “priority conventional energy projects” to continue during the government shutdown, while work on some renewable energy projects will halt.】

item.title: 美国政府关门如何影响气候工作
item.description: 美国政府因非必要事务而关闭。今天的时事通讯将关注政府关门对气候和天气项目的影响，以及政府关门会如何延迟洪水泛滥地区的房地产交易。根据一份内部备忘录，至少一些国家公园将幸免于难。【原文：The US government is closed for non-essential business​​. Today’s newsletter looks at the impacts on climate and weather programs, and at how the shutdown could delay real estate transactions within flood zones. At least some National Parks will be spared, according to an internal memo.】

item.title: 艾米风暴来袭，英国将遭受时速 80 英里的狂风袭击
item.description: 随着本季第一场有名字的风暴的临近，英国将遭遇高达 80 英里/小时的大风袭击。【原文：The UK is due to be hit by gale-force winds of up to 80mph as the first named storm of the season approaches.】

item.title: 米利班德抨击反气候改革是就业杀手
item.description: 英国能源大臣埃德-米利班德（Ed Miliband）为英国推进可再生能源的政策辩护，指责正在崛起的反对党英国改革党推行的政策会破坏英国工人阶级的就业机会。【原文：UK Energy Secretary Ed Miliband defended the country’s renewable energy push, accusing the rising opposition party Reform UK of pursuing policies that would destroy jobs for working class Britons.】

item.title: 欧洲央行分析显示欧洲银行利用了转型机遇
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）执行董事会成员弗兰克-埃尔德森（Frank Elderson）表示，欧洲银行正在建立竞争优势，追逐与绿色转型相关的机遇。【原文：European banks are building a competitive edge in chasing opportunities tied to the green transition, according to Frank Elderson, executive board member of the European Central Bank.】

item.title: 团体称日本必须更换核反应堆以实现 2040 年目标
item.description: 日本可能需要更换近六分之一的老化核反应堆，否则有可能无法实现 2040 年的能源目标。【原文：Japan may need to replace almost a sixth of its aging fleet of nuclear reactors or risk missing its 2040 energy targets.】

item.title: 美国政府关门导致关键天气和气候计划受阻
item.description:
从洪水保险到环境补助金，支持抵御自然灾害的项目预计将被削减。【原文：

From flood insurance to environmental grants, programs that support resiliency in the face of natural disasters are expected to be cut back.

】

item.title: 印度寻求加快水电审批以实现绿色目标
item.description: 印度将外包地质调查工作，以加快水电项目的审批速度，其中包括用于储能的项目，这是印度能源转型道路上的一个关键部分。【原文：India will outsource geological investigations to speed up the approval of hydroelectric projects, including those meant for energy storage, a key part of the country’s energy transition pathway.】

item.title: 尽管存在风险，国家公园仍被告知在关闭期间继续开放
item.description:
在2018年上一次政府关门期间，这些遗址仍向公众开放，但却遭到了破坏。【原文：

Sites were damaged when they remained open to the public during the last government shut down in 2018.

】

item.title: 人工智能推动欧洲顶级预报机构的天气数据需求激增
item.description: 欧洲最大的天气预报机构报告称，随着能源交易商、保险公司、航运公司和科技公司急于提高其人工智能模型的准确性，对其数据的需求创下新高。【原文：Europe’s biggest weather forecaster is reporting record demand for its data, as energy traders, insurers, shipping lines and tech companies rush to improve the accuracy of their AI models.】

item.title: 新西兰政府承诺为新发电厂提供资金
item.description: 新西兰政府表示，将支持其拥有多数股权的三家电力公司为新的发电项目筹集资金，即使这些项目不是可再生能源。【原文：New Zealand’s government said it will support the three power companies in which it has a majority shareholding to raise capital for new electricity generation, even if it is not renewable.】

item.title: 中国的绿色计划让投资者欲罢不能：环境、社会和治理投资
item.description: 上周，习近平主席在联合国会议上宣布了中国未来十年能源转型计划的高层次目标，投资者正翘首以盼更多相关细节。【原文：Investors are keenly awaiting more details about China’s energy-transition plans for the next decade, after President Xi Jinping announced high-level targets last week at a United Nations meeting.】

item.title: Trafigura 为二氧化碳排放权市场的 "巨大 "增长做好准备
item.description: 就在几年前，碳信用额市场还曾因被指 "洗绿 "而一蹶不振，如今却悄然卷土重来。【原文：The market for carbon credits, which just a few years ago was brought to its knees by allegations of greenwashing, is quietly staging a comeback.】

item.title: 巴西在气候峰会前加强对帮派和性犯罪的监控
item.description: 巴西正准备迎接数万名外国游客参加在贝伦举行的联合国 COP30 气候峰会，同时也在加强安保，以应对亚马逊地区两个最根深蒂固的问题：对儿童和青少年的性剥削，以及从城市黑社会跨越河流进入雨林的有组织犯罪。【原文：As Brazil prepares to welcome tens of thousands of foreign visitors for the United Nations’ COP30 climate summit in Belém, it is ramping up security to combat two of the Amazon region’s most entrenched problems: the sexual exploitation of children and teenagers, and organized crime, which reaches from the urban underworld across rivers and into the rainforest.】

item.title: 欧盟将提出措施堵塞碳边境税漏洞
item.description: 欧盟计划在今年年底前出台措施，堵住其旗舰气候政策之一的漏洞，该政策旨在阻止工业在欧盟转向绿色经济的过程中迁往国外。【原文：The European Union plans to introduce measures by the end of the year to close loopholes in one of its flagship climate policies, which was designed to stop industries from relocating abroad as the bloc shifts to a greener economy.】

item.title: 南非称 16 亿美元石油项目被法院叫停
item.description: 南非价值高达 16 亿美元的石油和天然气投资因环保组织提出的法律挑战而停止，这说明能源公司在该国面临着来自民间社会组织的阻力。【原文：South African oil and gas investments valued as much as $1.6 billion have been stopped by legal challenges brought by environmental groups, illustrating the resistance energy companies face from civil society organizations in the country.】

item.title: 塔塔钢铁达成 65 亿欧元减排协议
item.description: 塔塔钢铁有限公司（Tata Steel Ltd.）计划在其荷兰业务中减少排放，该项目可能耗资高达 65 亿欧元（76 亿美元）。【原文：Tata Steel Ltd. plans to cut emissions at its Netherlands operation in a project that could cost as much as €6.5 billion ($7.6 billion).】

item.title: 民主党人就美国洪水保险的未来向联邦紧急事务管理局施压
item.description:
参议员伊丽莎白-沃伦（Elizabeth Warren）和安迪-金（Andy Kim）对美国主要洪水保险提供商的稳定性表示担忧。【原文：

Senators Elizabeth Warren and Andy Kim raised concerns about the stability of the nation’s main flood-insurance provider.

】

item.title: 特朗普为煤矿开放 1,300 万英亩土地以援助濒临崩溃的煤炭行业
item.description: 特朗普政府将开放 1310 万英亩的联邦土地出租给煤矿工人，并为燃烧煤炭燃料的发电厂提供 6.25 亿美元的资金，这是帮助重振衰退行业的广泛举措的一部分。【原文：The Trump administration is opening 13.1 million acres of federal land for leasing to coal miners and providing $625 million for power plants that burn the fuel as part of a broad initiative to help revive the flagging industry.】

item.title: 纽森讨好大石油公司，天然气价格威胁政治野心
item.description: 去年，加州州长加文-纽森站在加州人民面前，宣布石油工业是 "这场气候危机的污染核心"。他说，大石油公司在撒谎、操纵和牟取暴利。"在签署了一项加强监督的法案后，他补充说："他们在坑害你们。【原文：Last year, Governor Gavin Newsom stood before Californians and declared the oil industry the “polluted heart of this climate crisis.” Big Oil, he said, was lying, manipulating and profiteering. “They’re screwing you,” he added, after signing a bill to bolster oversight.】

item.title: 报告称，美国将迎来 3500 亿美元的核电热潮，为人工智能提供动力
item.description: 据彭博情报公司（Bloomberg Intelligence）称，电力需求的飙升将推动美国耗资 3500 亿美元的核电开支热潮，到 2050 年，反应堆的产量将增加 63%。【原文：Soaring demand for electricity will drive a $350 billion nuclear spending boom in the US, boosting output from reactors by 63% by 2050, according to Bloomberg Intelligence.】

item.title: 中国涡轮机制造商聘请巴斯夫可再生能源公司首席执行官负责欧洲计划
item.description: 中国涡轮机制造商明阳智慧能源集团有限公司（Ming Yang Smart Energy Group Ltd.）聘请德国化工巨头巴斯夫公司（BASF SE）的可再生能源部门主管担任新任欧洲首席执行官，希望在该地区的风能市场重新站稳脚跟。【原文：Chinese turbine maker Ming Yang Smart Energy Group Ltd. has hired German chemical giant BASF SE’s head of renewables as its new European chief executive, hoping to regain footing in the region’s wind market.】

item.title: 小型核反应堆能否为人工智能的蓬勃发展和应对气候变化提供动力？
item.description: 近几十年来，世界上许多地方都在放弃传统核能。老化的核电站、高昂的建设成本、安全风险和放射性废物的挑战，使决策者和公众对原子能的经济性产生了质疑。直到最近，在实现气候目标和满足激增的电力需求的压力下，人们才重新燃起对这项技术的兴趣。【原文：Much of the world had been turning away from traditional nuclear power in recent decades. Aging plants, high construction costs, security risks and radioactive-waste challenges caused policymakers and the public to question the economics of atomic energy. Interest in the technology has only recently been revived amid pressure to hit climate goals and meet surging electricity demand.】
